content.html: Oh Sweet Mael! Reading now!
content.text: Oh Sweet Mael! Reading now!

content.html: Science needs Philosophy, now more than ever. This piece by brilliant @MMontevil explains much that our intuitions have been pointing to, in a very accessible way.
content.text: Science needs Philosophy, now more than ever. This piece by brilliant @MMontevil explains much that our intuitions have been pointing to, in a very accessible way.

content.html: Interesting piece! The idea of Computational Empircism is great for organizing currents in contemporary science. I wonder if this is more specifically a trend in biomedical sciences? Theorizing seems healthy in many fields, perhaps I'm aware of the exceptions that prove the rule?
content.text: Interesting piece! The idea of Computational Empircism is great for organizing currents in contemporary science. I wonder if this is more specifically a trend in biomedical sciences? Theorizing seems healthy in many fields, perhaps I'm aware of the exceptions that prove the rule?

content.html: Also, happy to continue the conversation in more detail on the @oolen_org forum!
content.text: Also, happy to continue the conversation in more detail on the @oolen_org forum!

content.html: Thank you! Indeed, it is an informal current and a trend. However, to my knowledge it is quite pervasive, reaching even humanities. Of course it is more advanced in some fields than others, and there are exceptions. I will say more in my editorial - it is part of a special issue.
content.text: Thank you! Indeed, it is an informal current and a trend. However, to my knowledge it is quite pervasive, reaching even humanities. Of course it is more advanced in some fields than others, and there are exceptions. I will say more in my editorial - it is part of a special issue.
